ul: For more information about unvalidated redirects and forwards, please see http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2010-A10-Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards

Don't Use Redirects or Forwards if Possible
      
        Calculate Destinations of Redirects and Forwards Without User Input
        
          Validate Destinations of Redirects and Forwards
          
            Use Mapping Values When Redirecting on User Input

Redirects and Forwards Are Not Used Unless Necessary
    
    
      Destinations of Redirects and Forwards Are Calculated Without User Input
    
    
      Destinations of Redirects and Forwards Are Validated
    
    
      Mapping Values Are Used for Redirects and Forwards
li: Find redirects and forwards. Find all pages that perform redirects or forwards.
Identify dangerous redirects and forwards. Find all redirects and forwards that rely on user input to calculate their destinations.

Rewrite redirects and forwards. Consider making design or code changes to get rid of each redirect or forward, if possible. If a redirect or forward is absolutely necessary, consider how it may be rewritten to operate without user input. This is usually possible based on assumptions made in the application design.
For more information about unvalidated redirects and forwards, please see http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2010-A10-Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards

p: Verify that destinations of redirects and forwards are calculated without user input.

Using input to calculate destinations of redirects or forwards may allow an attacker to create hyperlinks that appears to point to legitimate sites but redirect to malicious pages controlled by the attacker. This technique is often used by phishers to trick people into visiting fake sites that steal authentication credentials.
Look for code that handles parameters to see if it performs redirects or forwards based on input. Ideally, redirects and forwards should not rely on user input to calculate their destinations.
Perform the following actions to calculate destinations of redirects and forwards without user input:
Find redirects and forwards. Find all pages that perform redirects or forwards.
Identify dangerous redirects and forwards. Find all redirects and forwards that rely on user input to calculate their destinations.

Rewrite redirects and forwards. Consider making design or code changes to get rid of each redirect or forward, if possible. If a redirect or forward is absolutely necessary, consider how it may be rewritten to operate without user input. This is usually possible based on assumptions made in the application design.

html:
Applies to

  • PHP

What to Check For

Verify that destinations of redirects and forwards are calculated without user input.

Why

Using input to calculate destinations of redirects or forwards may allow an attacker to create hyperlinks that appears to point to legitimate sites but redirect to malicious pages controlled by the attacker. This technique is often used by phishers to trick people into visiting fake sites that steal authentication credentials.

How to Check

Look for code that handles parameters to see if it performs redirects or forwards based on input. Ideally, redirects and forwards should not rely on user input to calculate their destinations.

How to Fix

Perform the following actions to calculate destinations of redirects and forwards without user input:

  1. Find redirects and forwards. Find all pages that perform redirects or forwards.

  2. Identify dangerous redirects and forwards. Find all redirects and forwards that rely on user input to calculate their destinations.

  3. Rewrite redirects and forwards. Consider making design or code changes to get rid of each redirect or forward, if possible. If a redirect or forward is absolutely necessary, consider how it may be rewritten to operate without user input. This is usually possible based on assumptions made in the application design.

Additional Resources

  • For more information about unvalidated redirects and forwards, please see http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2010-A10-Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards

Redirect and Forward Validation Guidelines

  • Don't Use Redirects or Forwards if Possible
  • Calculate Destinations of Redirects and Forwards Without User Input
  • Validate Destinations of Redirects and Forwards
  • Use Mapping Values When Redirecting on User Input

Redirect and Forward Validation Checklists

  • Redirects and Forwards Are Not Used Unless Necessary
  • Destinations of Redirects and Forwards Are Calculated Without User Input
  • Destinations of Redirects and Forwards Are Validated
  • Mapping Values Are Used for Redirects and Forwards
